blog.name: thecomposerthatwaspromised
blog.title: "Jenny would dance with her ghosts"
blog.description: Side blog dedicated to Game of Thrones composer Ramin Djawadi, first of his name, player of instruments and writer of soundtracks / Spoilers & Ship war free / Askbox is always open :) / Main: @pierrotdameron

summary: Game of Thrones soundtrack retrospective: Season 3
title: Game of Thrones soundtrack retrospective: Season 3
body:
House Stark’s theme – 4 tracks: “I Paid the Iron Price”, “I Have to Go North”, “The Lannisters Send Their Regards”, “Heir to Winterfell" 

House Targaryen – 2 tracks: "Dracarys” (+ a theme for the dragons and the Unsullied), “Mhysa" 

House Lannister’s theme – 2 tracks: "A Lannister Always Pays His Debts”, “Kingslayer" 

House Greyjoy’s theme – 2 tracks: "I Paid the Iron Price”, “Reek” 

Petyr’s theme – 1 track: “Chaos Is a Ladder” 

White Walkers’ theme – 1 track: “White Walkers" 

Stannis / R'hllor’s theme – 1 track: "The Night Is Dark” 

Main theme – 1 track: “I Have to Go North" 

Jon & Ygritte’s Love theme – 1 track: "You Know Nothing" 

Marriage / Love theme – 1 track: "The Lannisters Send Their Regards" 

[Edit:]Honor’s theme – 1 track: "The Lannisters Send Their Regards” (when Cat says “On my honor as Tully” etc.)

Night’s Watch’s theme – 1 track: “Wall of Ice”    

One of my fav GoT album! For maybe the first in the show, the music is what makes the scene. I’m talking about the end of 2x04, Dany freeing the slaves in Astapor and the episode ending with the somewhat martial Unsullied theme, along with the dragons’ and the Targaryen’s in the end credit. Iconic.

The red wedding is a bit different since the music in the beginning of the sequence is diegetic (the characters can hear it), but then “The Lannisters Send Their Regards” arrives and it’s hell. Bonus: we can hear the “marriage” theme for a few seconds when Robb looks at Talysa’s corpse. :’’’))

And there’s “Mhysa”, which is, like, perfect. Listening to it on repeat since 2013.

To be noted: two tracks on the album are not used on the show: a choir version of the main theme, “Dark Wings, Dark Words” and guitar version, “For the Realm”. Also on repeat since 2013.

And that year we got 2 songs: “It’s Always Summer Under the Sea”, “The Bear and the Maiden Fair”. Shame we don’t have the instrumental version thought.

About the song (Vulture, 2013):

When Benioff and Weiss got the final version of the Hold Steady’s “The Bear and the Maiden Fair,” they were sitting with George R.R. Martin in Santa Fe, and played it for him on their laptops. “Before the second line was sung, we were all beaming over how great it was,” the showrunners said. “By the time the song was over, we’d already finished a bottle of tequila.” Kubler chuckles when he recalls the feedback they gave him. “They told me that they were dancing with George R.R. Martin,” he said, “so I assumed it involved something like a bottle of tequila.”

As thanks for contributing the song, Benioff and Weiss told Kubler that he could come to Belfast and make an appearance on the show — a not-unheard-of notion in the wake of the cameos done by Gary Lightbody from Snow Patrol and Will Champion from Coldplay. (At a recent event, Benioff explained to Vulture that both happened because the musicians asked nicely: “Gary came to visit the set because he lives in Northern Ireland —  he asked us if he could just come on. And Will came to us and asked the same thing, and we said, ‘Of course! We need a drummer for a big scene.’”) It’s the first time a musician has been invited to appear on the show. “They said, ‘We’ll give you a sword, and put you in a hallway somewhere,” Kubler said. “But I’ll see if they can write a cameo for us where we’re playing in a pub, and I’ve got a mandolin, which is one of my least favorite instruments, but hey.”

About “Mhysa” (Hollywood Reporter, 2019):

When it arrived, The Red Wedding was the climax of the series up to that point. One episode later, came a form of catharsis: Daenerys Targaryen reaching the Essos city of Yunkai and liberating the slave population, followed immediately by a veritable crowd-surfing sequence in which she’s embraced by these men, women and children. It’s a strong emotional counterpoint to the horror of the Red Wedding, a sign that there’s still hope in the world of Thrones, even with so many Starks dead and gone.

From an instrumentation standpoint, Djawadi looks fondly on “Mhysa” for its use of men, women and children’s choirs to support the mood, complete with what he describes as “Valyrian-inspired lyrics.”

“It’s not really Valyrian,” he explains, “but I took some of the sounds and some of the syllables and kind of created my own little language with it that felt like the rhythm of it and the sound of it. I actually liked that we didn’t have lyrics that really meant anything. … I’m not always good with words, I’m not always articulate, but I like when instrumental music makes you interpret a feeling without saying words. For me, personally, I just hear these syllables and sounds that match the feeling of what I wrote. There are some little Valyrian notes that I took from the language and modified so it doesn’t mean anything, but it [represents] Daenerys’ army growing, her powers growing, everything positive that’s developing about her character.”

Fav tracks: the all album is on repeat lol so here’s The Bear and the Maiden Fair by Gary Lightbody

Warning: Spoilers are discussed for Outlander series.

summary: GOT S7E6.  Don’t we have a “Jack and Rose could’ve shared the door” issue?  Uncle Benjen saves Jon Snow then sends him off his...
question: GOT S7E6.  Don’t we have a “Jack and Rose could’ve shared the door” issue?  Uncle Benjen saves Jon Snow then sends him off his horse saying there is no time for him to hop on too.  Benjen then goes to fight off the wights and presumably dies.  But there was plenty of time for him to mount the horse too.  And the horse could’ve held both men.  Remember in “Hold the Door” when UBJ saves Bran and Meera, puts them on his horse?  GOT is the best but Uncle Benjen could have been saved right?
answer: No, Jon didn’t pull a Titanic on Uncle Benjen. Here’s how I understand it: Benjen couldn’t go with Jon, no matter how much he wanted to and there was definitely room on the horse. Back in Season 6 when Benjen rescued Bran Flakes and Meera, he explained that after the wights killed him the Children of the Forest brought him back. They pierced his heart with dragonglass, just like they did when they created the first White Walker. But as a result, that meant he’s not quite dead nor truly alive, he’s just kind of stuck. He told Bran he couldn’t come with them and cross the Wall, because now the same magic and spells in the Wall meant to keep the White Walkers out also applied to him. So as long as the Wall was still standing, he couldn’t pass over it. And at the point when he rescued Jon, it was. But now that part of the Wall came tumbling down thanks to Eiffel 65 Viseron (Da Ba Dee Da Ba Daa), maybe that changes things for Benjen too. It’s quite possible we’ll see him south of the wall. Or maybe he’ll be dropped, they do have a ton of things to wrap up. If I’m wrong about any of this I’m sure tumblr will do it’s thing, but I’m pretty sure that’s the gist of it.

blog.name: teamtormund
blog.title: TeamTormund
blog.description:
Briemund shipping guide 2016-2018
My Briemund fics on AO3

summary: how sure are you that brienne will probably rather end up with tormund than with jaime since everyone seems so sure about jaime...
question: how sure are you that brienne will probably rather end up with tormund than with jaime since everyone seems so sure about jaime and brienne banging next season ( even though i don't get where this bullshit comes from and why people think so) I mean you're a briemund shipper like me, but seriously, what do you think of this all? If I had to choose, I'd probably rather have brienne without any man at her sides, i don't think she needs one!
answer:
I don’t care if Brienne ends up with Tormund. I just know that she’s not gonna end up with Jaime. That’s not what their arc is leading to (I have a BA in literature, so believe me when I say I know how those things work.) The rumour about Jaime and Brienne banging is one that the group that shall not be named is spreading every season to rally their dwindling number of followers. They’re going all-in this season, because it’s their last chance. They claiming to have a 100% legit source (a guy who claims to be an extra, who’ve become Nikolaj’s sand-in and even body double for naked scenes. Absolutely unbelievable “career”.) But I wouldn’t be surprised, if it’s just a lie made up by their Big Mama or one of her lapdogs. 

What I personally would love to happen between Brienne and Tormund is someting like this.

I don’t need them to bang, or even kiss, just to survive and look at each other one last time. Because if they’re still alive, there’s no way Tormung going to let up on his efforts to win Brienne’s heart.
